title.narrative: Life and Peace Institute, 2017-2022, The Ethiopia Program

description.narrative: Life and Peace Institut har ansökt som stöd hos ambassaden för sin verksamhet i Etiopien 2017-2020. Life and Peace ansöker om ca 31 MSEK. Denna insats omfattar ett samarbete med och finansiellt stöd till organisationen Life and Peace Institute och dess verksamhet i Etiopien. Insatsen syftar till att bryta negativa sociala mönster och andra strukturella hinder för fred och bidra till dialog och samarbete över religiösa och etniska gränser. LPI ska samarbeta med några nyckelaktörer som är universitet (lärare och studenter), interreligiösa rådet, Ministry of Federal affaris och Peace and Develoment Center. De bedöms alla vara strategiska samarbetspartners för att uppnå målen. LPI planerar bidra till att skapa plattformar för dialog och samarbete, bedriva forskning och kapacitetsutveckling av sina partners så de mer kompetent och professionellt kan axla en fredsbyggande roll.

The Life and Peace Institute (LPI) has applied to Sida for funding of approximately 31 MSEK to carry out its Ethiopia Program during the period 2017-2020. The total budget of the intervention is 45,3 MSEK. The program is currently partially funded by two donors, namely, USAID and Swedish Mission Council(SMC). USAID funds one project of the program with a contribution of 11,1 MSEK for the whole program period while SMC is a program-wide donor with a contribution of 3,2 MSEK for 2017-2018.
The intervention aims at contributing to reducing negative relational social patterns and support a culture of trust and collaboration between otherwise segregated or conflicted social groups by facilitating dialogue, research and collaborative action on local level and engaging relevant decision-makers and policy implementers to enhance structural conditions for peace.

The goal of the proposed intervention is to contribute to reducing negative relational social patterns and support a culture of trust and collaboration between otherwise segregated or conflicted social groups (could be based on ethnicity, religion, residential areas... etc, people that normally do not meet and engage in dialogue) by facilitating dialogue, research and collaborative action on local level and engaging relevant decision-makers and policy implementers to enhance structural conditions for peace.

description.narrative: With the advent of Covid-19 and successive ethnic/religious based conflict in the country and particularly in Universities, 2020 has been a challenging year for LPI. However, through adaptive programming, LPI has managed to implement activities. Accordingly, the following results have achieved: - LPI has worked towards scaling up the sustained dialogue project towards being adopted by target universities' management as a peace building intervention, reaching out to a higher number of the university community. Similarly, LPI has also started discussion with the ministry of higher education to have the sustained dialogue model adopted and rolled out in all universities. If LPI succeeds in this field, it will be a bid achievement. - In this reporting year, LPI build the capacity of CSOs working on conflict prevention and peacebuilding. This is an important contribution as CSO environment for this group of CSOs has been difficult before the current reform (2018). Hence, there is a need to strengthen such CSOs to play a role in the current conflict context in Ethiopia where the role of non-state actors to peace building can't be over emphasized. - Training on non-violent action is also a very relevant intervention within the Ethiopia context. It is hoped that the training will trickle down to reach the larger number of the community at different level. -LPI's Sensitive Land Administration project addresses important issues within the community at grassroots level. Equipping the community, especially the youth with tools to peacefully manage conflict will have long lasting and positive effect in the administration of scarce resources such as land and water.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
